pullRequest.title: Ensure that Java 12+ interfaces of java.lang.String are as CDI types
pullRequest.bodyText:
This is needed because when building with Java 12+ but targeting Java 8-11,
we need to ensure that the extra interfaces that java.lang.String implements
do not end up in the generated bytecode.
Fixes: #5062

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -45,6 +46,13 @@
 
     private static final Type OBJECT_TYPE = Type.create(DotNames.OBJECT, Kind.CLASS);
 
+    // we ban these interfaces because they are new to Java 12 and are used by java.lang.String which
+    // means that they cannot be included in bytecode if we want to have application built with Java 12+ but targeting Java 8 - 11
+    // actually run on those older versions
+    // TODO:  add a extensible banning mechanism based on predicates if we find that this set needs to grow...
+    private static final Set<String> BANNED_INTERFACE_TYPES = new HashSet<>(

beforeCommit.message:
Ensure that Java 12+ interfaces of java.lang.String are as CDI types

This is needed because when building with Java 12+ but targeting Java 8-11,
we need to ensure that the extra interfaces that java.lang.String implements
do not end up in the generated bytecode.

Fixes: #5062
